Also, if you wish an updated Hostiles ban list to block out most of the RIAA sponsored spammers, then see http://www.gnutellaforums.com/open-discussion/53973-technutopia-fullsize-hostiles-list-bearshare-limewire-7.html#post369129 again, not a spam link, a help link from Gnutella forums. :)

Yep, false-positives is when the anti-virus software gets it totally wrong. And not only anti-virus software but some other security software such as anti-spyware and anti-malware get it wrong too, sometimes because the developers of such software are anti-file sharing so automatically set the program to give such false results. Some such developers have admitted to doing this.

And then again, some security software will give a false-positive because it simply does not recognise some part of the software. This is actually a common reason. Ok there are many reasons, and another is so that such security software deliberately does it so it looks like you are getting what you paid for.

Getting reliable security software is something you need to research for reliability for results, and research the bad sides to such softwares.
